instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1708: What is A1708? A1708 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2017, 2016 with EMC 3164, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00840, 820-00875..
definitions.820-00840: What is 820-00840? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U6100: What is U6100? this is an SPI ROM chip that holds the BIOS which is necessary for the machine to POST or try and power on..
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PLT_RST_L: What is PLT_RST_L? This is an abbreviation of “PLT_RESET_L” – when you see “PLT_RST_L", assume the person meant to type PLT_RESET_L.

threads.title: 2017 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video no back light and no chime sound
threads.message:
Hello, I followed this post as close as possible because it sounded a lot like I have on this one

[URL unfurl="true"]https://boards.rossmanngroup.com/threads/<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-no-backlight-video.59001/[/URL]

Below are my results so far, help!!

<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a short on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>

<RESISTOR>R5400</RESISTOR> pin 2 short

<CHIP>U7420</CHIP> removed short gone have 13v now on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>

all main rails are there but no sound or video or backlight or external video

<SIGNAL>PPVCCCPU_S0G</SIGNAL> no volts and no short should be around 1v?

Tried switching <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> bios chip but did not change, not sure if the other bios chip was good pulled from another parts board

USB storage dongle flashes steady

<SIGNAL>PLT_RST_L</SIGNAL>   0v no short .380 diode

I have the same voltage results the other person had except for the ones above.

CPU does get warm but not hot.

I forgot to mention that the caps light never comes on.

Thanks

threads.title: 2017 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video no back light and no chime sound
threads.message:
Very likely dead CPU.
It was fried because of overvoltage passed thgrough <CHIP>U7420</CHIP>.

threads.title: 2017 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video no back light and no chime sound
threads.message:
That is what I was thinking, thanks for confirming my suspicion. 

Do you think it would be worth trying to heat up the CPU with some flux? What temperature and time frame would be good to try from your point of view?

Thanks again for your help!
